intro: Glomera acutiflora, commonly known as the sharpflower glomera, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, acute leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
